definition: to mention some but omit many others (idiom)/to leave out much more than one includes

to hang or suspend (from a hook etc)/to hang up (the phone)/(of a line) to be dead/to be worried or concerned/to make a phone call (dialect)/to register or record/classifier for sets or clusters of objects/(slang) to kill/to die/to be finished/to fail (an exam)
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
to leak/to divulge/to leave out by mistake/waterclock or hourglass (old)
surname Wan
ten thousand/a great number
see 万俟[Mo4 qi2]

sentences.english: This can only be due to the occasional touch, cite a few side can not but be regrettable omissions.
sentences.chinese: 本文只能因偶尔触及，略举数端，不免要挂一漏万的。

definition: partial view/limited outlook
shallow and crude/meager (knowledge or skill)
to speak in general terms
(conventional letter ending) words cannot fully express what is in my heart (idiom)
error and negligence
to compose in off-hand way (idiom); to dash off
lit. to see a leopard through a narrow tube (idiom); fig. to miss the big picture
to overlook/omissions/deficiencies
in my humble opinion (idiom)
lit. a dragon's scale from the east and a dragon's claw from the west/odds and ends (idiom)
to slip/to overlook by negligence/careless omission/oversight
(humble expr.) of humble talent and shallow learning (idiom); Pray forgive my ignorance,...
to pass on errors or lies (idiom); the propagation of misconceptions
lit. one scale and half a claw (idiom); only odd bits and pieces
to just talk for the sake of talking
lit. see one spot on a leopard (idiom); fig. a restricted view
